sentence.Network_en: He devoted his energies to the reformation of science.

sentence.Network_cn: 目前的住房制度正在彻底改革.

sentence.Network_en: The second part of Duffy's book is a detailed chronology of the Reformation.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Latin reformatio(n-), from reformare 'shape again' (see reform)

entry.def: The reformation of something is the act or process of changing and improving it.

example.ex: He devoted his energies to the reformation of science.

entry.tran: 宗教改革运动（16世纪天主教会的改革运动）
entry.def: The Reformation is the movement to reform the Catholic Church in the sixteenth century, which led to the Protestant church being set up.

example.ex: ...a famous statue of the Virgin which was destroyed during the Reformation.
example.tran: 在宗教改革运动中被毁的著名的圣母马利亚塑像

means.word_mean: 1. improvement (or an intended improvement) in the existing form or condition of institutions or practices etc.; intended to make a striking change for the better in social or political or religious affairs
2. rescuing from error and returning to a rightful course;
